briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to rot.
Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to rot.
Sets the matrix to specify a nonuniform scaling in x, y, and z by the factors in vector scaleFactors.
Returns the rotation corresponding to this matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This works well only if the matrix represents a rotation.
For good results, consider calling Orthonormalize() before calling this method.

memberdef.argsstring: (const GfVec3f &axis0, const GfVec3f &axis1, const GfVec3f &axis2) const
memberdef.name: DecomposeRotation

briefdescription.para: Decompose the rotation corresponding to this matrix about 3 orthogonal axes.

detaileddescription.para: If the axes are not orthogonal, warnings will be spewed.
This is a convenience method that is equivalent to calling ExtractRotation().Decompose().

briefdescription.para: Returns the quaternion corresponding to this matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This works well only if the matrix represents a rotation.
For good results, consider calling Orthonormalize() before calling this method.

briefdescription.para: Matrix storage, in row-major order.
Hash.
Returns the product of a matrix and a float.
Returns the unary negation of matrix m.
Adds matrix m2 to m1.
Subtracts matrix m2 from m1.
Multiplies matrix m1 by m2.
Divides matrix m1 by m2 (that is, m1 * inv(m2)).
Returns the product of a matrix m and a column vector vec.
Returns the product of row vector vec and a matrix m.
Default constructor. Leaves the matrix component values undefined.

memberdef.argsstring: (float m00, float m01, float m02, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m20, float m21, float m22)
memberdef.name: GfMatrix3f

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the matrix from 9 independent float values, specified in row-major order. For example, parameter m10 specifies the value in row 1 and column 0.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the matrix from a 3x3 array of float values, specified in row-major order.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Explicitly initializes the matrix to s times the identity matrix.

briefdescription.para: This explicit constructor initializes the matrix to s times the identity matrix.
Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Explicitly initializes the matrix to diagonal form, with the i th element on the diagonal set to v[i].

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the matrix from a vector of vectors of double. The vector is expected to be 3x3. If it is too big, only the first 3 rows and/or columns will be used. If it is too small, uninitialized elements will be filled in with the corresponding elements from an identity matrix.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the matrix from a vector of vectors of float. The vector is expected to be 3x3. If it is too big, only the first 3 rows and/or columns will be used. If it is too small, uninitialized elements will be filled in with the corresponding elements from an identity matrix.

briefdescription.para: Constructor. Initialize matrix from rotation.
Constructor. Initialize matrix from a quaternion.
This explicit constructor converts a "double" matrix to a "float" matrix.
Sets a row of the matrix from a Vec3.
Sets a column of the matrix from a Vec3.
Gets a row of the matrix as a Vec3.
Gets a column of the matrix as a Vec3.

memberdef.argsstring: (float m00, float m01, float m02, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m20, float m21, float m22)
memberdef.name: Set

briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix from 9 independent float values, specified in row-major order.

detaileddescription.para: For example, parameter m10 specifies the value in row 1 and column 0.

briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix from a 3x3 array of float values, specified in row-major order.
Sets the matrix to the identity matrix.
Sets the matrix to zero.
Sets the matrix to s times the identity matrix.
Sets the matrix to have diagonal (v[0], v[1], v[2]).
Fills a 3x3 array of float values with the values in the matrix, specified in row-major order.
Returns raw access to components of matrix as an array of float values.

detaileddescription.para: Components are in row-major order.

briefdescription.para: Returns const raw access to components of matrix as an array of float values.

detaileddescription.para: Components are in row-major order.

briefdescription.para: Returns vector components as an array of float values.
Returns vector components as a const array of float values.
Accesses an indexed row i of the matrix as an array of 3 float values so that standard indexing (such as m[0][1]) works correctly.
Accesses an indexed row i of the matrix as an array of 3 float values so that standard indexing (such as m[0][1]) works correctly.
Tests for element-wise matrix equality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Tests for element-wise matrix equality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Tests for element-wise matrix inequality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Tests for element-wise matrix inequality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Returns the transpose of the matrix.
Returns the inverse of the matrix, or FLT_MAX * SetIdentity() if the matrix is singular.

detaileddescription.para: (FLT_MAX is the largest value a float can have, as defined by the system.) The matrix is considered singular if the determinant is less than or equal to the optional parameter eps. If det is non-null, *det is set to the determinant.

briefdescription.para: Returns the determinant of the matrix.
Makes the matrix orthonormal in place.

detaileddescription.para: This is an iterative method that is much more stable than the previous cross/cross method. If the iterative method does not converge, a warning is issued.

Returns true if the iteration converged, false otherwise. Leaves any translation part of the matrix unchanged. If issueWarning is true, this method will issue a warning if the iteration does not converge, otherwise it will be silent.

briefdescription.para: Returns an orthonormalized copy of the matrix.
Returns the sign of the determinant of the matrix, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: 1 for a right-handed matrix, -1 for a left-handed matrix, and 0 for a singular matrix.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the vectors in the matrix form a right-handed coordinate system.
Returns true if the vectors in matrix form a left-handed coordinate system.
Post-multiplies matrix m into this matrix.
Multiplies the matrix by a float.
Adds matrix m to this matrix.
Subtracts matrix m from this matrix.
Sets matrix to specify a uniform scaling by scaleFactor.
Set the matrix to the rotation given by a quaternion, defined by the real component r and imaginary components i.
Stores a 3x3 matrix of float elements.

detaileddescription.para: A basic type.
Matrices are defined to be in row-major order, so matrix[i][j] indexes the element in the i th row and the j th column.
Three methods, SetRotate(), SetScale(), and ExtractRotation(), interpret a GfMatrix3f as a 3D transformation. By convention, vectors are treated primarily as row vectors, implying the following:

listitem.para: Transformation matrices are organized to deal with row vectors, not column vectors.
Each of the Set() methods in this class completely rewrites the matrix; for example, SetRotate() yields a matrix which does nothing but rotate.

When multiplying two transformation matrices, the matrix on the left applies a more local transformation to a row vector. For example, if R represents a rotation matrix and S represents a scale matrix, the product R*S will rotate a row vector, then scale it.
